words.definition: When a person is anxious, they worry that something bad will happen.
words.example: She was anxious about not making her appointment on time.

words.definition: When something is awful, it is very bad.
words.example: Her performance last night was awful.

words.definition: To consist of is to be made of parts or things.
words.example: Today's choices for lunch consisted of pizza, hamburgers, and hot dogs.

words.definition: To desire is to want something.
words.example: My sister desires a big house and lots of money.

words.definition: When a person is eager about something, they are excited about it.
words.example: The man was eager to talk about the good news.

words.definition: A household is all the people who live in one house.
words.example: Our household is made up of my father, my mother and me.

words.definition: An intent is a plan to do something.
words.example: Her intent is to visit Italy next summer.

words.definition: A landscape is how an area of land looks.
words.example: The landscape of the country is very green.

words.definition: To lift something is to move it higher.
words.example: The man tried to lift the box.

words.definition: To load is to put objects into something.
words.example: The man loaded the boxes into a truck.

words.definition: A lung is the organ in the body that fills with air when breathing.
words.example: Having strong lungs is necessary for a healthy life.

words.definition: A motion is a movement that someone makes.
words.example: The police officer made a motion with his hand.

words.definition: The pace of something is the speed at which it happens.
words.example: I ran the race at a slower pace than my friend.

words.definition: When someone is polite, they are acting in a thoughtful way.
words.example: The boy was very polite: he behaved very thoughtfully.

words.definition: To possess something is to have it or own it.
words.example: My uncle possesses three sheep, a chicken, a cow and a dog.

words.definition: When something happens rapidly, it happens very fast.
words.example: The train moved rapidly on the tracks.

words.definition: To remark is to say something.
words.example: The teacher remarked on how quickly the students were learning.

words.definition: To seek is to look for something.
words.example: If I have a problem, I seek my sister's advice.

words.definition: To shine is to make a bright light.
words.example: The candles are shining in the dark room.

words.definition: To spill is to have something fall out of its container.
words.example: I spilled the coffee on the table.
